page.title: 02FULFORD
page.content: The village of Fulford lies south of an old Roman road which used to pass between Draycott and Blythe Bridge. It got its name in Anglo Saxon times, it is said, from the dirty brook or Foulford, now gone. It is a nucleated settlement lying in a shallow valley about 190m above sea level. It is approached by narrow country lanes and has satellite hamlets of Crossgate, Mossgate and Spot Acre. Fulford has few of the amenities one would consider normal and this is the big disadvantage, there are however "skeleton" services which include:- A General store/Postoffice-but open mornings only.1-Public House,1-Church, 1-Telephone Box, a Primary School,Play Group,1-Youth Organisation and a Mobile Library which visits once a week. Altogether 489 persons live in the village in 189 dwellings.
